title: Welcome to My Blog
text:
Hello! Welcome to my personal blog. This is where I‚Äôll be sharing my thoughts, learnings, and insights about:

Machine Learning & AI: Latest developments, techniques, and applications
Engineering: Problem-solving approaches and technical solutions
Career & Growth: Lessons learned and experiences in tech
Life & Learning: Personal reflections and continuous learning journey

I believe in keeping things simple and focused. This blog is my digital notebook where I capture ideas, document learning, and share what I discover along the way.


I‚Äôll be writing about:

Technical deep-dives into ML/AI topics
Career insights and lessons learned
Tools and techniques I find useful
Thoughts on the future of technology




Feel free to reach out to me on Twitter or LinkedIn if you‚Äôd like to discuss any of these topics!
Happy reading! üöÄ

title: About Me
text:
I currently work as Manager, AI Engineering at Weights & Biases by CoreWeave, leading a small team of awesome AI Engineers. We focus on bringing down the entry of barrier to have an MLOps or LLMOps stack into a framework of your choice by building integrations, writing docs, creating educational content, and more. The crux of my work is to grow our usebase and have played a crucial role in doing so. As one of the earliest hire in the growth team, I have been involved with multiple key integrations, initiatives, projects, and more.
I have been in the field of AI for 5 years now and have worked with multiple frameworks, tools, and platforms. I have a strong background in Deep Learning, Computer Vision, and MLOps.


Manager, AI Engineering | Weights & Biases
February 2025 - Present

Lead a small team of AI Engineers focusing primarily on integrations today but plan to do a lot more amazing things in the future. Building a team to achieve the same.
Leading an effort to build our own algamation of benchmarks for for LLM/VLM evaluation and in turn build the framework for it.

Machine Learning Engineer | Weights & Biases
August 2020 - January 2025

Developed MLOps pipelines for popular open-source repositories/frameworks/orgs like Keras, OpenMMLab, Meta, XGBoost, and more.
Developed LLMOps integrations with LLM providers like OpenAI, Cohere, CrewAI, and more.
Reproduced research papers and wrote about them. Check them out here.
Built and evaluated wandbot, a Q&A RAG based chatbot.
Created courses on LLM applications and MLOps.
Written multiple blog posts and tutorials on Deep Learning, MLOps, RAG, Evaluation and more. Check them out here.
Owned the OS integration efforts.
Created and built our Kaggle Ambassador program. Became a Kaggle Notebooks Master in the process.

Technical Author | Weights & Biases January 2020 - August 2020

Wrote tehcnical reports (blog posts) on ML concepts. You can find them in my W&B profile.
Proud to have some of these reports featured in ‚ÄúTwo Minute Papers‚Äù





LLM apps: Evaluation
RAG++: From POC to Production
Training and Fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs) (*featured in a module because of my ‚ÄúStarter pack for NeurIPS LLM Efficiency Challenge 2023‚Äù.)





Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning (TensorFlow Core) (Aug 2022 - Present)
Kaggle Notebooks Master - Created numerous popular notebooks for competitions. You can find them in my Kaggle profile.




Bachelor of Engineering in Electronics and Communication Engineering | Netaji Subhash Engineering College, Kolkata, WB. 2016 - 2020
Schooling | Notre Dame Academy in Munger, Bihar.




Google Developer Group - Volunteer (Nov 2018 - Nov 2019)
Robonix 2018 - Assistant Head for Line Follower competition (Feb 2018 - Mar 2018)




I love thinking about hard problems and up-skilling myself to solve some.
In my free time, I love watching anime (Naruto is my all-time favorite, One Piece is love, and Solo Leveling is üî•).
Feel free to reach out to me on Twitter or LinkedIn for collaborations or discussions!

title: Ayush Thakur
text:
Hi, I‚Äôm Ayush ‚Äî an engineer who loves building, learning, and solving complex problems. I‚Äôm driven by curiosity rather than allegiance to any single discipline, which has led me to explore everything from electronics to machine learning, biology, and physics.
I hold a degree in Electronics and Communication Engineering. While my focus has shifted from circuits to code, my early work on autonomous robots gave me a strong foundation in systems thinking ‚Äî something I now bring to my work in AI. My goal is to bridge these domains to tackle problems that truly matter.
I currently work as a Manager, AI Engineer at Weights & Biases (now part of CoreWeave), where I lead our open source integration efforts. These projects help machine learning practitioners easily build complete MLOps stacks. Over my 5 years at W&B, I‚Äôve specialized in LLM application development and model evaluation, while also leading Kaggle initiatives, creating popular courses, and producing technical reports that drive visibility and growth.
I‚Äôm also a Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning and a Kaggle Master (Notebooks).
When I‚Äôm not coding, I enjoy watching anime (Naruto is my all-time favorite!) and sharing knowledge through technical articles. I have started with 3D printing as well. Stay tuned!
Know more about me from here.

title: Blog
text:
Welcome to my blog where I share my thoughts, experiences, and tutorials on machine learning, LLMs, and MLOps. I cover topics ranging from technical deep dives to practical implementation guides, with a focus on making complex concepts accessible.
If you‚Äôre interested in specific topics, use the filters above to narrow down the posts by category, or use the search function to find exactly what you‚Äôre looking for.
Feel free to share these posts and reach out with questions or feedback. I‚Äôm always happy to engage with the community!
